description: {"blocks":[{"key":"56tao","text":"This protocol describes the processing and storing of explanted idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) lungs by the Comprehensive Transplant Center (CTC) Human Tissue Biorepository before arrival at the TriState SenNet Biospecimen Core of The Ohio State University that functions as a part of the Cellular Senescence Network Program (SenNet). This protocol is based on the CTC Human Tissue Biorepository's standard operating procedure established for tissue collection for explant and donor samples.  We follow routine laboratory specimen processing guidelines to ensure the highest biospecimen quality.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: OSU TriState SenNet Processing and Storing of Explanted IPF Lungs

funders.funder_name: TriState SenNET (Lung and Heart) Tissue Map and Atlas consortium - NIA

groups.title: Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet) Method Development Community

keywords: SenNET, OSU TMC, TriState, biospecimen, Human lung tissue, IPF

efficiency","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9mp6","text":"·Nalgene biohazard bin lined with red medium biohazard bag","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7081b","text":"·Autoclaved surgical kit containing 2 surgical scissors, 2 tweezers, and 2 hemostats ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aih6i","text":"·Cryovial rack","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rd96","text":"·5 mL (PVP)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4dk7","text":"·mold","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Objective
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7cam","text":"To preserve lung tissue for further downstream cellular, protein, RNA, or DNA analyses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8kcqu","text":"Use appropriate PPE that includes nitrile gloves and disposable gown or washable lab coat.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"91bu","text":"Place three underpads and all needed equipment, including biohazard, receptacles, surgical kit, and specimen holders in the biosafety cabinet (BSC) and turn on. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fnffb","text":"Lungs come from the OR separated left from right lungs in sterile plastic containers. Place container inside the BSC, remove lungs from containers, place on the underpad, and photograph lungs prior to sampling. The photograph should show both lungs with their respective lobes, front and back. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"es810","text":"Samples are collected from the area most representative to the disease. IPF lung tissue is fibrotic and this is characterized by the thickening and scarring of the tissue that feels hard and stiff to the touch. Identify the most representative areas in the upper and lower lobes of a lung. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"clbr0","text":"Resect a 10 cm x 10 cm x 2 cm (L x W x H) piece of parenchymal tissue from the representative sections of the upper and lower lobes and set aside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7mgju","text":"Collect four pulmonary lymph nodes around the primary bronchus in 5mL cryovials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Freezing and storing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"67e6n","text":"The following procedure is performed for the upper lobe and the lower lobe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Freezing and storing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bnj77","text":"Cut six small pieces of tissue (4mm3) from each piece of parenchyma and place onto the internal sides of a labeled cryovial using forceps. Collect ten cryovials of parenchyma from the upper and lower lobes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Freezing and storing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a52pc","text":"Lower the cryovials into liquid nitrogen and leave for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Freezing and storing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"19n77","text":"Remove the cryovials from liquid nitrogen and store in the -80°C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"11hj7","text":"The following procedure is performed for the upper lobe and the lower lobe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8vmbd","text":"For FFPE preserved samples: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bvgfo","text":"Add 3mL 10% neutral buffered formalin (NBF) to the 5mL cryovial containing lymph nodes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1jgvr","text":"Cut four 1.25 cm3 pieces of tissue from each piece of parenchyma and place into a labeled 20 mL glass scintillation vial filled halfway with NBF. Top off NBF if needed and protect from light. Samples must be submerged for at least 24 hours and no longer than 72 hours to ensure complete saturation and to prevent overfixation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5v7u6","text":"Remove tissue from NBF and use a scalpel to cut the tissue into \u003c2mm thickness pieces that are small enough to fit into the tissue cassette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3hlh7","text":"Enclose tissue into the cassettes and then submerge in 70% ethanol. Histology is performed using standard methods.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"25cbr","text":"For OCT preserved samples: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fmhhb","text":"Cut tissue into 1.25 cm3 pieces and transfer tissue into 4% paraformaldehyde for 24 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":23,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"30q80","text":"Transfer to 30% of sucrose for 24 hours and then embed in a mold with OCT and dry ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9c969","text":"Store in -80°C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3eh34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m9ta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hb19","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cai3o","text":"For Lipidomics and Proteomics analyses:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f61b0","text":"Cut the tissue into 1 x 1 cm pieces for freezer preservation in 75% of Hydroxypropyl\nmethylcellulose (HPMC) and 2.5% of polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP) at -80°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"729o5","text":"Embed in a mold with HPMC-PVP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Processing formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) and OCT samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2bcsl","text":"Store in a -80°C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
